bill_title: to increase the minimum age at which a person may contribute to a horse or dog race.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the minimum age at which a person may contribute to a horse or dog race. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 42-7-76 be amended to read as follows: 42-7-76. The certificate system shall expressly authorize authorizes the right of a licensee to collect and receive contributions of money from any person eighteen twenty-one years or older toward the entry of any horse or dog in such a race selected by such the person to run first in the race , and the . The person contributing such the money shall acquire acquires an interest in the total money contributed on all horses and dogs in the race as first winner in proportion to the amount of money contributed by such the person. The licensee shall receive such the contributions of money and issue to the contributors thereof certificates on which shall be shown the number of the race, the amount contributed, and the number or name of the horse or dog selected by such the person as first winner. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
